intro: Ficus carica var. nucleata, commonly known as the common fig, is a deciduous tree native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and its unique fruit, the fig, which develops inside a protective囊 (invaginated) structure. The plant produces both male and female flowers, with the female flowers developing into the edible fruit. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires a temperate climate with adequate sunlight. The tree is widely cultivated for its nutritious fruit and has a long history of use in agriculture and horticulture.
